sire noun [C]
(KING)
old use used as a form of address to a king: I will serve you always, sire.

to become the male parent of an animal or the father of a child: The foal was sired by a cup-winning racehorse.old use or humorous At the age of 70, he married a much younger woman and went on to sire two more children. Synonyms
beget old use
father
